A 2000s Basement VRChat World

Xbox 360 achievements, retro DOS terminal, real-time weather, cross-platform VR. Lower Level 2.0 recreates the quintessential 2000s basement gaming atmosphereâ€”complete with persistent progress tracking, dynamic weather effects, and an interactive DOS terminal that feels like coming home.

[ The Story ]

Lower Level 2.0 started as a simple VRChat world and evolved into an 18,000+ line codebase built entirely with AI collaboration. From zero UdonSharp experience to a fully-featured achievement system, interactive DOS terminal, and real-time weather integrationâ€”all developed through systematic Claude Code workflows.

The project demonstrates what's possible when combining modern AI tools with creative vision: persistent player data, cross-platform optimization, and a nostalgic 2000s basement aesthetic that feels like coming home.

[ Core Features ]

Achievement System
  • 19 achievements (420G)
  • PlayerData persistence
  • 7 role-based tiers

Xbox 360-style popups that save your progress across sessionsâ€”earn them all and flex your Gamerscore.

Basement OS
  • 80-char DOS terminal
  • 14 Terminal Tales
  • MUSIC.EXE player

A fully interactive retro terminal with short stories, a music player, and live world stats.

Weather Integration
  • Live weather API
  • 7 weather conditions
  • Quest-optimized cache

Real-world weather synced to the basementâ€”rain on the windows when it's raining outside.

Network Sync
  • FIFO notification queue
  • UdonSynced broadcast
  • Role personalization

Everyone sees achievement unlocks in real-timeâ€”celebrate together when someone hits a milestone.
